description:
Western blotting WB (immunoblotting) is a widely practiced analytical technique to detect target proteins within samples using antigen-specific antibodies. WB involves two major
processes: Separation of soluble proteins into discrete bands and transfer of those proteins onto a solid matrix for subsequent analysis by immunological probes.

 

Under standard denaturing conditions, SDS-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE) is used to separate sample proteins based on polypeptide length. The separated proteins are transferred (blotted) onto a membrane matrix of nitrocellulose or PVDF where they are stained with antibody probes specific to target protein antigens. Typically, blots are incubated with antibodies against the antigen of interest followed by a secondary antibody and detection.

 

Analysis of protein migration and the intensity of chromogenic, chemiluminescent, or fluorescent signals offer protein expression details from cells or tissue homogenates. When
coupled with high-resolution gel electrophoresis, antibodies of strong avidity and specificity to target antigens, and robust signal reporting, Western blotting can detect picogram quantities of protein.
keywords: western blot, wb, gel electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, immunoblot
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working.

components.data: Culture cells in the cell culture dish until 80% confluency.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Culture cells in the cell culture dish until 80% confluency.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cell Culture Protein Extraction
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Cell Culture Protein Extraction

components.data: Place the dish on ice and rinse the cells in ice-cold PBS buffer (10 mM Na2HPO4 and 1.8 mM Na2H2PO4 with 0.2% Tween 20; pH 7.4).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the dish on ice and rinse the cells in ice-cold PBS buffer (10 mM Na2HPO4 and 1.8 mM Na2H2PO4 with 0.2% Tween 20; pH 7.4).

components.data: Aspirate the PBS and add ice-cold lysis buffer (150 mM NaCl, 1% NP-40, 50 mM Tris-HCl and protease inhibitors).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the PBS and add ice-cold lysis buffer (150 mM NaCl, 1% NP-40, 50 mM Tris-HCl and protease inhibitors).

components.data: Scrape adherent cells off the dish using a cold plastic cell scraper or digest the cells with 0.05% trypsin cells with PBS wash. Be as gentle as possible with the cells to avoid inducing cell stress pathways.
components.name: Description

components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare the diluted BSA standards by mixing the diluent and BSA as follows:

 

Tube Diluent Volume (µL) BSA Volume (µL) BSA Concentration (µg/mL)
A 0 600 (From Tube A) 2000
B 100 300 (From Tube A) 1500
C 300 300 (From Tube A) 1000
D 200 200 (From Tube B) 750
E 300 300 (From Tube C) 500
F 300 300 (From Tube E) 250
G 300 300 (From Tube F) 125
H 400 100 (From Tube G) 25
I (Blank) 300 0 0
components.name: Description

components.data:
Cover and incubate tubes with one of the protocols:

  • Standard Protocol: 37°C for 30 minutes (WR: 25 to 2,000 μg/mL).
  • RT Protocol: Room temperature for 2 hours (WR: 25 to 2,000 μg/mL).
  • Enhanced Protocol: 60°C for 30 minutes (WR: 5 to 250 μg/mL).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Cover and incubate tubes with one of the protocols:

  • Standard Protocol: 37°C for 30 minutes (WR: 25 to 2,000 μg/mL).
  • RT Protocol: Room temperature for 2 hours (WR: 25 to 2,000 μg/mL).
  • Enhanced Protocol: 60°C for 30 minutes (WR: 5 to 250 μg/mL).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 31 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Increasing the incubation time and temperature can increase the net 562 nm absorbance for each test and decrease both the minimum detection level of the reagent and the working range of the protocol. Use a water bath to heat the tubes for either the Standard (37°C incubation) or the Enhanced (60°C incubation) Protocol. Using a forced-air incubator can introduce significant error in color development because of uneven heat transfer.
source_data.thread_text: Increasing the incubation time and temperature can increase the net 562 nm absorbance for each test and decrease both the minimum detection level of the reagent and the working range of the protocol. Use a water bath to heat the tubes for either the Standard (37°C incubation) or the Enhanced (60°C incubation) Protocol. Using a forced-air incubator can introduce significant error in color development because of uneven heat transfer.
source_data.body: Increasing the incubation time and temperature can increase the net 562 nm absorbance for each test and decrease both the minimum detection level of the reagent and the working range of the protocol. Use a water bath to heat the tubes for either the Standard (37°C incubation) or the Enhanced (60°C incubation) Protocol. Using a forced-air incubator can introduce significant error in color development because of uneven heat transfer.

components.data: With the spectrophotometer set to 562 nm, “zero” the instrument on a cuvette filled only with water. Subsequently, measure the absorbance of all the samples within 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: With the spectrophotometer set to 562 nm, “zero” the instrument on a cuvette filled only with water. Subsequently, measure the absorbance of all the samples within 10 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 33 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Because the BCA Assay does not reach a true end point, color development will continue even after cooling to room temperature. However, because the rate of color development is low at room temperature, no significant error will be introduced if the 562 nm absorbance measurements of all tubes are made within 10 minutes of each other.
source_data.thread_text: Because the BCA Assay does not reach a true end point, color development will continue even after cooling to room temperature. However, because the rate of color development is low at room temperature, no significant error will be introduced if the 562 nm absorbance measurements of all tubes are made within 10 minutes of each other.
source_data.body: Because the BCA Assay does not reach a true end point, color development will continue even after cooling to room temperature. However, because the rate of color development is low at room temperature, no significant error will be introduced if the 562 nm absorbance measurements of all tubes are made within 10 minutes of each other.

components.data: Subtract the average 562 nm absorbance measurement of the blank standard replicates from the 562 nm absorbance measurement of all other individual standard and unknown sample replicates.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Subtract the average 562 nm absorbance measurement of the blank standard replicates from the 562 nm absorbance measurement of all other individual standard and unknown sample replicates.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Protein Quantitation Assay - Quantitation Assay
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Protein Quantitation Assay - Quantitation Assay

components.data: Prepare a standard curve by plotting the average blank-corrected 562 nm measurement for each BSA standard vs. its concentration in μg/mL. Use the standard curve to determine the protein concentration of each unknown sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare a standard curve by plotting the average blank-corrected 562 nm measurement for each BSA standard vs. its concentration in μg/mL. Use the standard curve to determine the protein concentration of each unknown sample.

components.data: Electrophoresis - Gel Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Electrophoresis - Gel Preparation

components.data:
The first step of gel preparation is to determine the gel percentage based on the molecular weight of your protein sample:

 

Protein Size (kDa) >200 15-200 10-70 12-45 4-40
Gel Percentage 6% 8% 10% 12% 20%

 

If you are not sure of the size of your protein or are looking at proteins of a variety of molecular weights, then a gradient gel may provide the best resolution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The first step of gel preparation is to determine the gel percentage based on the molecular weight of your protein sample:

 

Protein Size (kDa) >200 15-200 10-70 12-45 4-40
Gel Percentage 6% 8% 10% 12% 20%

 

If you are not sure of the size of your protein or are looking at proteins of a variety of molecular weights, then a gradient gel may provide the best resolution.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 36 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: • We recommend using the SDS-PAGE Gel Preparation Kit is available from us (AR0138, Boster Bio). It contains most of the reagents for the gel preparation and can be used to make both SDS-PAGE gel and non-native PAGE gel, respectively.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 45 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation:
Dual Color Protein Loading Buffer is designed to prevent protein degradation during sample heating prior to electrophoresis and is able to work against pH changes during the SDS-PAGE run. Many proteins are sensitive to pH changes that result from temperature fluctuations of Tris buffers during electrophoresis.

 

It contains 2 tracking dyes: blue (Bromophenol Blue) for tracking the progress of electrophoresis and pink (Pyronin Y) for monitoring protein transfer to the membrane. Refer to the datasheet on our website for more information.
source_data.thread_text:
Dual Color Protein Loading Buffer is designed to prevent protein degradation during sample heating prior to electrophoresis and is able to work against pH changes during the SDS-PAGE run. Many proteins are sensitive to pH changes that result from temperature fluctuations of Tris buffers during electrophoresis.

 

It contains 2 tracking dyes: blue (Bromophenol Blue) for tracking the progress of electrophoresis and pink (Pyronin Y) for monitoring protein transfer to the membrane. Refer to the datasheet on our website for more information.
source_data.body:
Dual Color Protein Loading Buffer is designed to prevent protein degradation during sample heating prior to electrophoresis and is able to work against pH changes during the SDS-PAGE run. Many proteins are sensitive to pH changes that result from temperature fluctuations of Tris buffers during electrophoresis.

 

It contains 2 tracking dyes: blue (Bromophenol Blue) for tracking the progress of electrophoresis and pink (Pyronin Y) for monitoring protein transfer to the membrane. Refer to the datasheet on our website for more information.

components.data: Electrophoresis - Pre-electrophoresis Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Electrophoresis - Pre-electrophoresis Sample Preparation

components.data:
You may also use one of the following reagents/methods instead of the Dual Color Protein Loading Buffer: 

  • 2X SDS-PAGE Protein Loading Buffer (AR0131, Boster Bio) at 1:1 ratio (i.e. add 100 µg sample to 100 µL Loading Buffer)
  • 5X SDS-PAGE Protein Loading Buffer (AR1112, Boster Bio) at 4:1 ratio (i.e. add 400 µg sample to 100 µL Loading Buffer)
  • 2X SDS-PAGE Tricine Protein Loading Buffer (AR1143, Boster Bio) at 1:1 ratio (i.e. add 100 µg sample to 100 µL Loading Buffer) if detecting protein with MW < 10 kDa
  • Laemmli 2X Buffer (4% SDS, 10% 2-mercaptoethanol, 20% glycerol, 0.004% bromophenol blue, 0.125 M Tris-HCl; pH 6.8) at 1:1 ratio (i.e. add 100 µg sample to 100 µL Loading Buffer)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
You may also use one of the following reagents/methods instead of the Dual Color Protein Loading Buffer: 

  • 2X SDS-PAGE Protein Loading Buffer (AR0131, Boster Bio) at 1:1 ratio (i.e. add 100 µg sample to 100 µL Loading Buffer)
  • 5X SDS-PAGE Protein Loading Buffer (AR1112, Boster Bio) at 4:1 ratio (i.e. add 400 µg sample to 100 µL Loading Buffer)
  • 2X SDS-PAGE Tricine Protein Loading Buffer (AR1143, Boster Bio) at 1:1 ratio (i.e. add 100 µg sample to 100 µL Loading Buffer) if detecting protein with MW < 10 kDa
  • Laemmli 2X Buffer (4% SDS, 10% 2-mercaptoethanol, 20% glycerol, 0.004% bromophenol blue, 0.125 M Tris-HCl; pH 6.8) at 1:1 ratio (i.e. add 100 µg sample to 100 µL Loading Buffer)

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis

components.data: Carefully remove the well-creating comb from the gel and rinse wells with the electrophoresis buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully remove the well-creating comb from the gel and rinse wells with the electrophoresis buffer.

components.data: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis

components.data: Pipette your samples into the wells quickly to prevent possible sample diffusion inside the well (For a well with maximum 30 µL, load 20 to 25 µL of 1 µg/µL sample per well).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette your samples into the wells quickly to prevent possible sample diffusion inside the well (For a well with maximum 30 µL, load 20 to 25 µL of 1 µg/µL sample per well).

components.data: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis

components.data: Pipette 10 µL of appropriate controls and/or molecular weight standards in separate well(s).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 10 µL of appropriate controls and/or molecular weight standards in separate well(s).

components.data: Connect the anode and cathode of the electrophoresis appropriately.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Connect the anode and cathode of the electrophoresis appropriately.

components.data: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis

components.data: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis

components.data: Turn on the power to run electrophoresis at 100V/130V* until the bromophenol blue dye reaches the gel bottom (This can take 1.5 to 3 hours). You should observe fine bubbles from the gel apparatus bottom as this observation indicates sufficient electric current is generated.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn on the power to run electrophoresis at 100V/130V* until the bromophenol blue dye reaches the gel bottom (This can take 1.5 to 3 hours). You should observe fine bubbles from the gel apparatus bottom as this observation indicates sufficient electric current is generated.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 54 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: • In a discontinuous system, the electrophoresis voltage for stacking gel is lower than that for resolving gel to ensure that proteins are concentrated on the same level before running into the resolving gel.
source_data.thread_text: • In a discontinuous system, the electrophoresis voltage for stacking gel is lower than that for resolving gel to ensure that proteins are concentrated on the same level before running into the resolving gel.
source_data.body: • In a discontinuous system, the electrophoresis voltage for stacking gel is lower than that for resolving gel to ensure that proteins are concentrated on the same level before running into the resolving gel.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 54 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: * The applied voltage should be adjusted according to the gel thickness, the power supply used, and the resolution desired.
source_data.thread_text: * The applied voltage should be adjusted according to the gel thickness, the power supply used, and the resolution desired.
source_data.body: * The applied voltage should be adjusted according to the gel thickness, the power supply used, and the resolution desired.

components.data: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Electrophoresis - Loading Samples and Running Electrophoresis

components.data: Turn off the power when the protein samples have finished migrating in the gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn off the power when the protein samples have finished migrating in the gel.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Gel Staining (Optional)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Gel Staining (Optional)

components.data:
After electrophoresis, we recommend using one of our gel staining solutions to determine if the electrophoretic separation works. Refer to the datasheet(s) on our website for more information.

  • Coomassie Blue Staining & Destaining Solution (AR0140, Boster Bio)
  • Coomassie Blue Fast Staining Solution (AR0170, Boster Bio)
  • Protein Silver Staining Reagents (AR0171, Boster Bio)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
After electrophoresis, we recommend using one of our gel staining solutions to determine if the electrophoretic separation works. Refer to the datasheet(s) on our website for more information.

  • Coomassie Blue Staining & Destaining Solution (AR0140, Boster Bio)
  • Coomassie Blue Fast Staining Solution (AR0170, Boster Bio)
  • Protein Silver Staining Reagents (AR0171, Boster Bio)

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 56 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Stained gel cannot be used in the subsequent protein transfer procedure.
source_data.thread_text: Stained gel cannot be used in the subsequent protein transfer procedure.
source_data.body: Stained gel cannot be used in the subsequent protein transfer procedure.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Blotting Membrane Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Blotting Membrane Preparation

components.data: Cut the blotting membrane (NC or PVDF) according to the size of your gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut the blotting membrane (NC or PVDF) according to the size of your gel.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 57 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Tips: Cut a good supply of membranes in advance! Store in a cool, dry place.
source_data.thread_text: Tips: Cut a good supply of membranes in advance! Store in a cool, dry place.
source_data.body: Tips: Cut a good supply of membranes in advance! Store in a cool, dry place.

components.data: Carefully mark the membrane orientation by cutting a corner or marking it with a pencil.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully mark the membrane orientation by cutting a corner or marking it with a pencil.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Blotting Membrane Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Blotting Membrane Preparation

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Blotting Membrane Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Blotting Membrane Preparation

components.data: Soak the membrane in methanol for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Soak the membrane in methanol for 1 minute.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Blotting Membrane Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Blotting Membrane Preparation

components.data: Immerse the membrane in 5 minutes with 1X transfer buffer (25 mMTris base, 190 mM glycine and 20% methanol; pH 8.3) (AR1149, Boster Bio) and rock the membrane gently until it sinks and the water no longer beads up on the surface.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the membrane in 5 minutes with 1X transfer buffer (25 mMTris base, 190 mM glycine and 20% methanol; pH 8.3) (AR1149, Boster Bio) and rock the membrane gently until it sinks and the water no longer beads up on the surface.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data:
Based on a sandwich model, install the electric transfer cassette in the following order: 
Foam Pad → Filter Paper → Gel → Membrane→ Filter Paper→ Foam Pad
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Based on a sandwich model, install the electric transfer cassette in the following order: 
Foam Pad → Filter Paper → Gel → Membrane→ Filter Paper→ Foam Pad

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data:
We recommend using one of the transfer pads from Boster:

  • Fast and Efficient Transfer Pad, 12.5 cm X 12.5 cm (AR0172, Boster Bio)
  • Fast and Efficient Transfer Pad, 9 cm X 7.5 cm (AR0173, Boster Bio)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
We recommend using one of the transfer pads from Boster:

  • Fast and Efficient Transfer Pad, 12.5 cm X 12.5 cm (AR0172, Boster Bio)
  • Fast and Efficient Transfer Pad, 9 cm X 7.5 cm (AR0173, Boster Bio)

Fast & Efficient Transfer Pad (9 cm x 7.5 cm)

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Soak two filter papers in a separate container with the same transfer buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Soak two filter papers in a separate container with the same transfer buffer.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Crack open the transfer cassette with a spatula and make sure to loosen the cassette hold all the way around before carefully pulling apart the two halves.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Crack open the transfer cassette with a spatula and make sure to loosen the cassette hold all the way around before carefully pulling apart the two halves.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 65 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Before doing anything with the gel, such as cutting it, pay careful attention to the location of lane #1.
source_data.thread_text: Before doing anything with the gel, such as cutting it, pay careful attention to the location of lane #1.
source_data.body: Before doing anything with the gel, such as cutting it, pay careful attention to the location of lane #1.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Cut the gel according to the size of the membrane with a razor blade and then cut the corner on the side of the gel with lane #1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut the gel according to the size of the membrane with a razor blade and then cut the corner on the side of the gel with lane #1.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Immerse the gel in 1X transfer buffer for 15-30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the gel in 1X transfer buffer for 15-30 minutes.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Place the gray or black plate of the transfer cassette on a clean surface.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the gray or black plate of the transfer cassette on a clean surface.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Place one pre-wetted foam pad on the gray side of the cassette.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place one pre-wetted foam pad on the gray side of the cassette.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Place a moistened sheet of filter paper on the foam pad.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place a moistened sheet of filter paper on the foam pad.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Carefully peel the gel off of the remaining half of the gel cassette and place it on the filter paper.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully peel the gel off of the remaining half of the gel cassette and place it on the filter paper.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 71 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Moisten the gel with transfer buffer and use a serologically clean pipette or a Falcon tube, as if it were a rolling pin, to roll air bubbles out of the membrane.
source_data.thread_text: Moisten the gel with transfer buffer and use a serologically clean pipette or a Falcon tube, as if it were a rolling pin, to roll air bubbles out of the membrane.
source_data.body: Moisten the gel with transfer buffer and use a serologically clean pipette or a Falcon tube, as if it were a rolling pin, to roll air bubbles out of the membrane.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Place the membrane onto the gel with the corners matched up.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the membrane onto the gel with the corners matched up.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 72 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Once the membrane contacts the gel, it should not be moved or “ghost bands” can result.
source_data.thread_text: Once the membrane contacts the gel, it should not be moved or “ghost bands” can result.
source_data.body: Once the membrane contacts the gel, it should not be moved or “ghost bands” can result.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Complete the sandwich by placing a piece of filter paper onto the membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Complete the sandwich by placing a piece of filter paper onto the membrane.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Add the second foam pad on top of the filter paper.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the second foam pad on top of the filter paper.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Transfer Cassette

components.data: Lock the transfer cassette firmly with the white latch.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Lock the transfer cassette firmly with the white latch.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 75 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Be careful not to move the gel and the filter paper sandwich. Make sure that the foam pads, filter papers, and membrane are thoroughly immersed in the transfer buffer.
source_data.thread_text: Be careful not to move the gel and the filter paper sandwich. Make sure that the foam pads, filter papers, and membrane are thoroughly immersed in the transfer buffer.
source_data.body: Be careful not to move the gel and the filter paper sandwich. Make sure that the foam pads, filter papers, and membrane are thoroughly immersed in the transfer buffer.

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Protein Transfer Run

components.data: Firmly insert transfer cassette into the slot of the transfer apparatus.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 79 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: The gel should be closer to the cathode and the membrane should be closer to the anode. Negatively charged proteins will migrate towards the anode.
source_data.thread_text: The gel should be closer to the cathode and the membrane should be closer to the anode. Negatively charged proteins will migrate towards the anode.
source_data.body: The gel should be closer to the cathode and the membrane should be closer to the anode. Negatively charged proteins will migrate towards the anode.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Protein Transfer Run
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Protein Transfer Run

components.data: Set the power source to constant voltage and operate at 25 V for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Set the power source to constant voltage and operate at 25 V for 30 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 80 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: • The transfer can be completed overnight at a lower voltage, for example, 10 V.
source_data.thread_text: • The transfer can be completed overnight at a lower voltage, for example, 10 V.
source_data.body: • The transfer can be completed overnight at a lower voltage, for example, 10 V.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 80 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Transfer time and voltage should be optimized according to the gel concentration. Higher gel concentration requires additional time.
source_data.thread_text: Transfer time and voltage should be optimized according to the gel concentration. Higher gel concentration requires additional time.
source_data.body: Transfer time and voltage should be optimized according to the gel concentration. Higher gel concentration requires additional time.

components.data: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Protein Transfer Run
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Protein Transfer (To Membrane) - Wet Transfer - Protein Transfer Run

components.data:
Check the protein transfer efficiency by membrane staining:

 

Place the membrane in Ponceau S staining (0.2% w/v Ponceau S; 5% glacial acetic acid) or our Imprinted Membrane Fast Reversible Protein Staining Reagent (AR0142, Boster Bio) for 5-10 minutes. A visible red band will appear. The membrane may be de-stained completely by repeatedly washing in wash buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Check the protein transfer efficiency by membrane staining:

 

Place the membrane in Ponceau S staining (0.2% w/v Ponceau S; 5% glacial acetic acid) or our Imprinted Membrane Fast Reversible Protein Staining Reagent (AR0142, Boster Bio) for 5-10 minutes. A visible red band will appear. The membrane may be de-stained completely by repeatedly washing in wash buffer.

source_data.reagent_name: Imprinted Membrane Fast Reversible Protein Staining Reagent

components.data: Membrane Blocking
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Membrane Blocking

components.data: Rinse the blotting membrane 3X using TBS Wash Buffer (20 mMTris, pH 7.5; 150 mMNaCl; 0.05% Tween 20) (AR0144, Boster Bio) at room temperature for 10 minutes each time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse the blotting membrane 3X using TBS Wash Buffer (20 mMTris, pH 7.5; 150 mMNaCl; 0.05% Tween 20) (AR0144, Boster Bio) at room temperature for 10 minutes each time.

components.data: Membrane Blocking
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Membrane Blocking

components.data: After rinsing, immerse the blotting membrane in TBS Blocking Buffer (5% non-fat dry milk in buffer of 20 mMTris, pH 7.5; 150 mMNaCl) (AR0143, Boster Bio) and incubate for 1.5 - 2 hours at room temperature (or overnight 4°C) with shaking.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After rinsing, immerse the blotting membrane in TBS Blocking Buffer (5% non-fat dry milk in buffer of 20 mMTris, pH 7.5; 150 mMNaCl) (AR0143, Boster Bio) and incubate for 1.5 - 2 hours at room temperature (or overnight 4°C) with shaking.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 83 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: Alternatively, buffer containing non-fat dried milk, gelatin, or BSA can be used. For use with biotin systems or detection of phosphoproteins, non-fat dried milk is not recommended.
source_data.thread_text: Alternatively, buffer containing non-fat dried milk, gelatin, or BSA can be used. For use with biotin systems or detection of phosphoproteins, non-fat dried milk is not recommended.
source_data.body: Alternatively, buffer containing non-fat dried milk, gelatin, or BSA can be used. For use with biotin systems or detection of phosphoproteins, non-fat dried milk is not recommended.

components.data: Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antibody Incubation

components.data: After blocking, the membrane is incubated with a primary antibody (that binds to the target protein) followed by an HRP-conjugated or AP-conjugated secondary antibody.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After blocking, the membrane is incubated with a primary antibody (that binds to the target protein) followed by an HRP-conjugated or AP-conjugated secondary antibody.

components.data: https://www.bosterbio.com/products/primary-antibodies.html
components.name: External Link

components.data: https://www.bosterbio.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=HRP+secondary+antibody
components.name: External Link

components.data: Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antibody Incubation

components.data: Dilute the primary antibody with the TBS Wash Buffer (AR0144, Boster Bio). Follow the antibody protocol from the manufacturer for optimal dilution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute the primary antibody with the TBS Wash Buffer (AR0144, Boster Bio). Follow the antibody protocol from the manufacturer for optimal dilution.

components.data: Incubate the primary antibody and the membrane at 4°C overnight or for 1-2 hours at room temperature. For the best results, incubation time and antibody concentration may need to be optimized.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the primary antibody and the membrane at 4°C overnight or for 1-2 hours at room temperature. For the best results, incubation time and antibody concentration may need to be optimized.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antibody Incubation

components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the membrane 3X with the TBS Wash Buffer (AR0144, Boster Bio) for 10 minutes each to remove unbound antibody.

components.data: Incubate the secondary antibody and the membrane at 4°C overnight or 1-2 hours at room temperature on a shaker.

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - ECL Substrate Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - ECL Substrate Preparation

components.data:
Choose the correct ECL kit† according to the species that the primary antibody is raised.

 

Origin of Primary Antibody Species Catalog No. of ECL Kit*
Mouse IgG EK1001
Rabbit IgG EK1002
Goat IgG EK1003
Rat IgG EK1004
Mouse IgM EK1005

* Each kit has sufficient reagents for 800 cm2 of membrane.

 

The ECL kit provides:

1) Chromogenic reagents A and B (20X concentrated; 5 mL)

2) Blocking buffer

3) HRP-conjugated secondary antibody

 

 

† Instead of using the ECL kit, one may use one of the following standalone chromogenic reagents A and B from Boster:

 

  Reagent A Reagent B  
Product Concentration Volume Concentration Volume Catalog No.
Hypersensitive ECL Substrate 1X** 100 mL 1X** 100 mL AR1170
Hypersensitive WB Substrate 20X 5 mL 20X 5 mL CR0001-5
Hypersensitive WB Substrate 20X 10 mL 20X 10 mL CR0001-10
Hypersensitive WB Substrate 20X 25 mL 20X 25 mL CR0001-25

** Ready-to-use
components.name: Description

components.data: Signal Detection
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection

components.data: In this section, we provide the protocols for the Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) and Colorimetric Detection (DAB) methods. Use the method that fits your preferences and criteria.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In this section, we provide the protocols for the Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) and Colorimetric Detection (DAB) methods. Use the method that fits your preferences and criteria.

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - ECL Substrate Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - ECL Substrate Preparation

components.data:
Prepare the ECL substrate solution by mixing the following and use the solution within 2 hours of preparation:
- 50 µL of 20X Chromogenic Reagent A (Luminol & Luminious Enhancer)
- 50 µL of 20X Chromogenic Reagent B (Peroxidase & Stabilizer)
- 1 mL of distilled water
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the ECL substrate solution by mixing the following and use the solution within 2 hours of preparation:
- 50 µL of 20X Chromogenic Reagent A (Luminol & Luminious Enhancer)
- 50 µL of 20X Chromogenic Reagent B (Peroxidase & Stabilizer)
- 1 mL of distilled water

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Membrane Treatment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Membrane Treatment

components.data: Thoroughly cover the membrane with the substrate solution (use 1 mL of solution for 10 cm2 of the membrane).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thoroughly cover the membrane with the substrate solution (use 1 mL of solution for 10 cm2 of the membrane).

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Membrane Treatment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Membrane Treatment

components.data: Incubate the membrane at room temperature until bands appear (usually 1-5 minutes; incubation time can be estimated in dark room).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the membrane at room temperature until bands appear (usually 1-5 minutes; incubation time can be estimated in dark room).

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Membrane Treatment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Membrane Treatment

components.data: Gently blot the edge of the membrane on a piece of paper to remove excess substrate solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently blot the edge of the membrane on a piece of paper to remove excess substrate solution.

components.data: Put a clear preservative film or transparent glass paper over the membrane and remove any air bubbles observed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put a clear preservative film or transparent glass paper over the membrane and remove any air bubbles observed.

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Membrane Treatment
components.name: Section

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Film Development and Fixing
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Film Development and Fixing

components.data: Develop and fix the film in a dark room immediately using our recommended WB Developing and Fixing Kit (AR0132, Boster Bio). Alternatively, fluorescence CCD scan, digital imager or luminometer can be used.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Develop and fix the film in a dark room immediately using our recommended WB Developing and Fixing Kit (AR0132, Boster Bio). Alternatively, fluorescence CCD scan, digital imager or luminometer can be used.

components.data: Put the X-ray film over the membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put the X-ray film over the membrane.

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Film Development and Fixing
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Film Development and Fixing

components.data: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Film Development and Fixing
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Film Development and Fixing

components.data: Develop the film by immersing it in developing solution for 10 seconds to 10 minutes. Determine the exposure time required by observing under red light and stop developing once the film achieves the experimental purpose. Multiple exposures may be necessary for the optimal signal to noise ratio.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Develop the film by immersing it in developing solution for 10 seconds to 10 minutes. Determine the exposure time required by observing under red light and stop developing once the film achieves the experimental purpose. Multiple exposures may be necessary for the optimal signal to noise ratio.

components.data: Wash the film with clean water (to remove the developing solution completely) and stop washing when bands appear.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the film with clean water (to remove the developing solution completely) and stop washing when bands appear.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Enhanced Chemiluminescence Detection (ECL) - Film Development and Fixing

components.data: Immerse the film in fixing solution for 3-5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the film in fixing solution for 3-5 minutes.

components.data: Wash the film with clean water to remove the fixing solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the film with clean water to remove the fixing solution.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 103 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: • WB Stripping Buffer (AR0153, Boster Bio) is recommended to remove primary and secondary antibodies on the membrane if proteins on the membrane need to be reused.
source_data.thread_text: • WB Stripping Buffer (AR0153, Boster Bio) is recommended to remove primary and secondary antibodies on the membrane if proteins on the membrane need to be reused.
source_data.body: • WB Stripping Buffer (AR0153, Boster Bio) is recommended to remove primary and secondary antibodies on the membrane if proteins on the membrane need to be reused.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 103 of Western Blot Protocol
source_data.annotation: • Use the control protein levels to normalize the target protein levels.
source_data.thread_text: • Use the control protein levels to normalize the target protein levels.
source_data.body: • Use the control protein levels to normalize the target protein levels.

components.data: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - DAB Substrate Preparation (For HRP-conjugated secondary antibodies)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - DAB Substrate Preparation (For HRP-conjugated secondary antibodies)

components.data:
Choose the correct DAB kit according to the species that the primary antibody is raised and the desirable color:

 

Origin of Primary Antibody Species Color Catalog No. of DAB Kit
Mouse IgG Yellow SA2020
Goat IgG Yellow SA2021
Rabbit IgG Yellow SA2022
Rat IgG Yellow SA2023
Mouse IgG Blue SA2024
Rabbit IgG Blue SA2025
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Choose the correct DAB kit according to the species that the primary antibody is raised and the desirable color:

 

Origin of Primary Antibody Species Color Catalog No. of DAB Kit
Mouse IgG Yellow SA2020
Goat IgG Yellow SA2021
Rabbit IgG Yellow SA2022
Rat IgG Yellow SA2023
Mouse IgG Blue SA2024
Rabbit IgG Blue SA2025

source_data.reagent_name: Western Blotting Mouse IgG DAB Chromogenic Reagent Kit (Yellow)
Western Blotting Goat IgG DAB Chromogenic Reagent Kit (Yellow)
Western Blotting Rabbit IgG DAB Chromogenic Reagent Kit (Yellow)
Western Blotting Rat IgG DAB Chromogenic Reagent Kit (Yellow)
Western Blotting Mouse IgG DAB Chromogenic Reagent Kit (Blue)
Western Blotting Rabbit IgG DAB Chromogenic Reagent Kit (Blue)

components.data: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - DAB Substrate Preparation (For HRP-conjugated secondary antibodies)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - DAB Substrate Preparation (For HRP-conjugated secondary antibodies)

components.data:
Prepare the DAB substrate solution by mixing the following:
- 50 µL of 40X Chromogenic Reagent A (DAB)
- 50 µL of 40X Chromogenic Reagent B (H2O2)
- 50 µL of 40X Chromogenic Reagent C (TBS Wash Buffer)
- 2 mL of distilled water
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the DAB substrate solution by mixing the following:
- 50 µL of 40X Chromogenic Reagent A (DAB)
- 50 µL of 40X Chromogenic Reagent B (H2O2)
- 50 µL of 40X Chromogenic Reagent C (TBS Wash Buffer)
- 2 mL of distilled water

components.data: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - BCIP/NBT Substrate Preparation (For AP-conjugated secondary antibodies)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - BCIP/NBT Substrate Preparation (For AP-conjugated secondary antibodies)

components.data:
Prepare the BCIP/NBT substrate solution by mixing the following:
- 50 µL of 20X Chromogenic Reagent A (BCIP/NBT)
- 50 µL of 20X Chromogenic Reagent B (Tris concentrated buffer, pH 9.4)
- 1 mL of distilled water
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the BCIP/NBT substrate solution by mixing the following:
- 50 µL of 20X Chromogenic Reagent A (BCIP/NBT)
- 50 µL of 20X Chromogenic Reagent B (Tris concentrated buffer, pH 9.4)
- 1 mL of distilled water

components.data: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - Membrane Treatment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - Membrane Treatment

components.data: Thoroughly cover the membrane with the substrate solution (use 1 mL of solution for 10 cm2 of the membrane).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thoroughly cover the membrane with the substrate solution (use 1 mL of solution for 10 cm2 of the membrane).

components.data: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - Membrane Treatment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - Membrane Treatment

components.data: Incubate the membrane at room temperature until bands appear (usually 10-30 minutes). Incubation for BCIP/NBT should be done in the dark.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the membrane at room temperature until bands appear (usually 10-30 minutes). Incubation for BCIP/NBT should be done in the dark.

components.data: Wash the membrane in distilled water to stop the reaction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the membrane in distilled water to stop the reaction.

components.data: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - Membrane Treatment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - Membrane Treatment

components.data: Observe the bands and take pictures.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Observe the bands and take pictures.

components.data: Signal Detection - Colorimetric Detection - Membrane Treatment
components.name: Section
